item.title: Dungeonborne: How To Craft Healing Potions
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Craft Healing Potions In Dungeonborne
  • Bandages Or Healing Potions In Dungeonborne
  • Where To Get Cloudy Life Essence In Dungeonborne

Characters in Dungeonborne don't naturally heal after life is lost, making healing an important aspect of surviving long enough to extract. There are a few items that can be used to heal, with one the most basic one being the Healing Potion.

Healing Potions can be found randomly while exploring, but it won't always be enough to keep a player alive very long in a dungeon. Potions can be purchased at the camp between rounds, but gold has many other uses, and luckily, Healing Potions can be crafted; here's how to do it.

How To Craft Healing Potions In Dungeonborne

  • Restores 10 life per second for 30 seconds.

Healing Potions don't act right away but have a quick use time as your character only drinks the potion, unlike bandages which take up to six seconds to use. Potions can only be crafted while at camp and at the Alchemist for three vials of Cloudy Life Essence . There is no cost or wait time to craft these potions, and overall Cloudy Life Essence is a common item, making it best for players to stock up on Healing Potions whenever they can.

Healing Potions can also be purchased at the Merchant, but once players fall into a rhythm of extracting often, crafting will be the better option just about every time. The only dilemma players will have is that bandages are crafted using the same resource.

Bandages Or Healing Potions In Dungeonborne

  • Immediately restores 300 life after being used, but takes 6 seconds to apply.

After collecting Cloudy Life Essences, players will need to choose how to spend them, with both of these items ultimately restoring 300 life in total. It comes down to what players prefer for the class they are using, but never forget the importance of staying on the move in this game. While the monsters alone are deadly in this game, another player can always be around the corner ready to take you down. While the potions do lead to a delayed healing, their quick use add makes them a much safer option , and one that can be used in combat.

Where To Get Cloudy Life Essence In Dungeonborne

Cloudy Life Essence is one of the most common items players will find during a round, unlike Heirlooms which are much more rare. This item is constantly found on dead monsters or chests , with the drop rates being about the same. Cloudy Life Essence also has a very high stack limit, letting players collect hundreds and only take up a few inventory slots. Cloudy Life Essences are also common rewards for completing daily quests . Players' main concern in getting this item should be extracted, as finding it will rarely be the issue.

item.title: A Rumored Fire Emblem Remake Needs An Update Soon
item.description: Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy, aka FE4, has been in demand for a remake by the Fire Emblem community for years. Thanks to a giant leak in 2022 that confirmed Engageâ€™s existence, it also included the existence of the long-awaited FE4 remake, and with the details of Engage being completely accurate, it has many fans excited at the genuine possibility of an FE4 remake in the near future.

item.title: 8 Best Capcom Characters Who Are Canonically Dead
item.description:
Capcom has had a storied history in the video game industry, having developed and published games since the 1980s. The company has developed such a strong roster of characters over its 45 years of existence that it has created several popular crossover games featuring its roster, including Marvel vs. Capcom and Namco x Capcom .

There are many characters in the Capcom catalog, each with their own backgrounds and stories. While many popular characters like Ryu and Leon Kennedy continue to be relevant in their respective franchises, some characters have reached the end of their stories and have even died. Here are some of the best Capcom characters that are canonically dead.

8 Arkham (Devil May Cry 3)

A Crazed Scholar Who Sought Demonhood

Arkham is the main antagonist of Devil May Cry 3 and the estranged father of Lady. A scholar who yearned for demonic power, Arkham sacrificed his own wife in order to attain power. He then pit the sons of Sparda, Vergil and Dante, against each other in order to unseal Temen-ni-gru. He used his alternate persona as the Jester to guide them toward the tower.

Despite all of his machinations, Arkham failed to achieve the same level of power as Sparda, ultimately losing to both Vergil and Dante, who put aside their rivalry to defeat him. He still managed to survive the fight, albeit reverted to his human form. However, he was discovered and killed by Lady, who was there to take revenge for her mother.

7 William Birkin (Resident Evil 2)

The Scientist Behind The Outbreak

William Birkin, despite only appearing in a handful of Resident Evil games, is possibly one of the most important characters in that series' world. While working with fellow scientist Albert Wesker, Birkin created the T-virus, which caused Raccoon City's outbreak.

While working on the G-virus, Birkin was attacked by the Umbrella Special Forces, who stole his completed research. Left for dead, Birkin injected himself with the G-virus, which eventually mutates him into the monster known as G. He would continue to stalk the streets of Raccoon City in his monstrous form until he is eventually killed by Leon Kennedy and Claire Redfield in Resident Evil 2 .

6 Fou-Lu (Breath Of Fire 4)

A Surprisingly Sympathetic RPG Villain

Fou-Lu is the main villain of Breath of Fire 4 , a later entry in one of Capcom's classic JRPG franchises. Fou-Lu is the founder of the Fou Empire, having awakened after a centuries-long sleep in order to wait for the birth of his "other half," Ryu.

For short segments in the game, Fou-Lu is actually playable, allowing players to sympathize with his perspective. However, that does not stop him from coming into contact with Ryu and his allies, after which he is defeated and killed in battle.

5 Asura (Asura's Wrath)

The Vengeful God Of Wrath

Asura was once one of the Eight Guardian Generals, but a ploy to use his daughter, Mithra, to generate Mantra pushes the other Generals to betray him and frame him for the murder of his wife, Durga. Though he is defeated, Asura returns to take his revenge and save his daughter once and for all in Asura's Wrath .

Asura goes on a rampage, slaughtering the Eight Generals one by one in order to save his daughter. As he continues to grow in power and rage, Asura ultimately loses his life against another powerful god, though he is eventually reincarnated millions of years later as a human.

4 Charlie Nash (Street Fighter Alpha 3)

Guile's Long-Lost Comrade

In Street Fighter Alpha 3 , Charlie Nash was a member of the United States Air Force and a friend of Guile. The two worked together to hunt down the elusive M. Bison, but during one of his fights against Bison, he is shot in the back by a helicopter and is considered killed in action.

Some years later, Charlie reappears during Street Fighter 5 's story mode, seemingly brought back from certain death. He continues his relentless journey to destroy M. Bison, but his body explodes during a showdown against the mighty villain, leaving him dead yet again.

3 Mia Fey (Phoenix Wright)

The Ever-Reliable Lawyer From The Beyond

Mia Fey was Phoenix Wright 's mentor and a capable defense lawyer with a storied history in the profession. Unfortunately, her career was cut short when she died at the end of Phoenix's very first case, leaving him to fend for himself in a court system that is incredibly hostile to defendants.

Despite her death, Mia would return from beyond the grave in order to help Phoenix in his cases, using her sister Mia's ability to channel spirits to do so. Mia has been vital in helping Phoenix defend his clients, proving that even death wouldn't stop her from uncovering the truth.

2 Albert Wesker (Resident Evil 5)

The Cunning Mastermind Scientist

Albert Wesker is the most iconic villains in the Resident Evil franchise, and one that is responsible for many of the crises that occur throughout the series. His initial role had him pose as a S.T.A.R.S. Captain, but in truth, he was covertly helping Umbrella conduct their viral experiments.

Though he seemingly died in the first Resident Evil game, Wesker was revealed to be alive due to having an experimental virus in his body. He returned as a major villain in Resident Evil 5 , where he was ultimately killed by Chris Redfield and Sheva Alomar.

1 X (Mega Man X)

The Legendary Hero's Final Rest

X is the first major successor to the original Mega Man series, whose main role is to hunt down Mavericks â€” criminal Reploids who have rebelled against humanity. X ultimately became known as a legendary hero, one who did his best to defend humanity at all costs.

In between the Mega Man X and Zero series, a series of events caused X to be detached from his body, becoming a Cyber-elf. Though he continued to live in this form, he was forced to sacrifice himself in order to protect Zero during the events of Mega Man Zero 3 , causing him to fade away completely.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for July 25, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another challenging puzzle for fans of word games to figure out. If you are stuck on this one, you aren't alone. This is probably the hardest puzzle that the New York Times Games has concocted. If you aren't very familiar with the subject, you will probably be pretty lost without some help.

If you already know how to play Strands but are stuck on today's puzzle, this article is full of help for you. This contains things like helpful hints, spoilers for individual words, and more. If you are stuck today, this article has everything you need to get back on track and get a win.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #144 for July 25, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has nine items to find, including a Spangram category and eight themed words. The clue for this one is All That Jazz .

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you don't like the in-game hint system for Strands because it spoils whole words, you can find some general hints below. Each of these sections contains a single hint that will get you closer to the theme in this relaxing puzzle game.

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Each of the sections below contains one spoiled word and its position in the letter grid. If a spoiler would help you out in this challenging puzzle game, you can click on the sections below to see them.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The complete spoiler for today's Strands is in the expandable section below. Press the Read More button to see the full answer.

Today's Strands Explained

If this innovative puzzle game has you down because you just don't get it, check out the section below. In it, you can see a full explanation for how the theme and the words and the clue all fit together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #410 July 25, 2024
item.description:
Connections is a short, daily word game from the New York Times Games. Every day, it gives you a selection of seemingly-random words that need to be sorted into categories. Other than the words themselves, you don't get a single clue for what the categories might be.

And today's puzzle is much more challenging than the rules of Connections might make it sound. There are so many overlapping words that could go in several categories, and there are also a lot of red herring word combinations as well. If you are running out of tries and want to win, this article can help.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #410 for July 25, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Wax, Mummy, Gift, Anchor, Burrito, Present, Clay, Papyrus, Sprain, Flair, Moderate, Talent, Instinct, Parchment, Host, and Faculty.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If a hint or two would help you through this difficult puzzle game, check below. Each of these sections contains a different clue or spoiler to help you get closer to the answer.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #410 for July 25, 2024

The complete spoiler for today's New York Times Connections is located in the expandable section below. In it, you can find all four categories and the words that fit into each one.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.
